newsitem.title: USA: BHP to continue Centurion project effort.
newsitem.headline: BHP to continue Centurion project effort.

text.p: BHP Mineral International Exploration Inc has notified Centurion Mines Corp that it will continue into the next stage of the project at "Little Bingham" porphyry copper prospect, Centurion said Monday.
The Broken Hill Proprietary Co Ltd subsidiary will make a $20,000 cash payment to Centurion, and has the option to earn a 75 percent interest in the prospect, the company said.
The project, which is located 70 miles southwest of Salt Lake City and 14 miles west of Eureka, Utah, was started in January 1996.
Exploration results to date, including geologic, geophysical and geochemical work, plus drilling, are favorable, Centurion said in a statement.

BHP has advised Centurion that additional drilling will be carried out as soon as permits are issued, the company said. This exploration program will be directed toward the discovery of a large commercial porphyry type copper deposit.
